fields.description:
h3. Current Scenario
* When using Slack Integration with Confluence, users are able to select which notifications would be sent to a slack channel (Ref. [Use Slack and Confluence together|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-slack-and-confluence-together/]), however these messages cannot be customized.

h3. Suggestion
* Allow users to edit and customize messages that would be sent to Slack channels, providing even greater connectivity and clarity when conveying messages through this connection.
fields.summary: Allow Slack messages customization

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * Hide *archived pages* to anonymous users.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 * Go to the *page* you want to archive.
 * Open the *More actions* menu (•••).
 * Click *Archive*.

h3. Expected Results
 * The archived page should *not* appear to anonymous users.

h3. Actual Results
 * The archived page *still* appearing to anonymous users.

h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Archived pages must not appear to anonymous

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

When loading a SpaceApp app, an error message "App is not available" is displayed. Refreshing the page, navigating to a different Forge app, or navigating away from the app then back to the app all cause the app to render properly, without the error message
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space in a tenant with at least one SpacePage app installed
 # Navigate to {{/wiki/spaces/<space key>/overview}}
 # Click on sidebar link to SpacePage app

Note: If the error message is not displayed in the app content area, go to a different page that is not an app (like {{/wiki/spaces/<space key>/overview}}), refresh, and repeat the above steps; the message should display this time.
h3. Expected Results

The SpacePage app should render correctly.
h3. Actual Results

The error message in the attached screenshot is displayed in the app content area. 
h3. Workaround

Refreshing the page or navigating away and back causes the app to render correctly.
fields.summary: Loading a SpacePage app initially displays an "App is not available" message

fields.description:
Customers using annual billing currently have no easy way to automate the auditing of license consumption per-site.
In order to allow the automation of auditing, and notifications centered directly around the consumption of licenses, I would like to propose that the Confluence REST API include endpoints to allow this information to be accessed by site admins via scripts.
fields.summary: Add License Count and Consumption information to REST API

fields.description: h3. Issue Summary If a space has pages with Lucidchart diagrams, and this space is relatively large, taking more than 5 minutes to be exported to PDF, the export may fail. h3. Steps to Reproduce # Create a complex space with high quantity of pages # Create a few pages with Lucidchart diagrams (in different positions on the page tree) # Try to export the entire space to PDF h3. Expected Results The space should be exported without problems h3. Actual Results If the export takes more than 5 minutes, it may fail. h3. Notes This happens because the token for the temporary lucid-chart image only lasts 5 minutes, causing a 403 http status if the conversion to PDF tries to access that image after that period: {code:none} AccessDenied Request has expired 300 2020-11-09T19:12:32Z 2020-11-09T19:18:57Z (...) (...) {code} Internal errors: {code:none}stack: java.io.IOException: Server returned HTTP response code: 403 for URL: https://atlassian-lucidchart-com.s3.amazonaws.com/(...)/(...)/page-0.png{code} {code:none}Failed to load URL: https://atlassian-lucidchart-com.s3.amazonaws.com/(...)/(...)/page-0.png?X-Amz-Security-Token=(LONG_TOKEN_STRING_&X-Amz-Algorithm=AWS4-HMAC-SHA256&X-Amz-Date=20201109T190732Z&X-Amz-SignedHeaders=host&X-Amz-Expires=300&X-Amz-Credential=(...)%2F20201109%2Fus-east-1%2Fs3%2Faws4_request&X-Amz-Signature=(...){code} h3. Workaround Either: * Select less pages to be exported, decreasing the export time OR * Don't select the pages containing Lucid-chart diagrams OR * Export the space to HTML, as the problem shouldn't affect it
fields.summary: Space containing lucidchart diagrams may fail to be exported to PDF if the export takes more than 5 minutes

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * *Archived spaces* shouldn't appear in the general list of spaces in the *Space Directory*. Instead, they’ll appear in the *Archived Spaces* list.
 * [Archive a space|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/archive-a-space/] as a reference.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # *Create* a space on Confluence.
 # Go to *Space Settings > Archive Space*.
 # Click on the button *Archive space*.
 # Go to *Spaces > View all spaces*.

h3. Expected Results
 * See the space only in the *Archived Spaces* list

h3. Actual Results
 * You can see the archived space in the general list as well.

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Archived spaces still appearing in the general list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
* The new UI for Space directory is missing the filter to only show Site Spaces

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# In Confluence, click on *Spaces* near the top navigation bar and select *View all Spaces*.
# This will load the new Space directory.
** *New:* (Confluence-domain)/wiki/spaces
** *Old:* (Confluence-domain)/wiki/spacedirectory/view.action
# While the rest of the filters are available, the filter to only list Site Spaces, and to exclude Personal Spaces is missing.
**  !NEWSpaceDire.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
# The new Space Directory UI should have the filter to only show Site Spaces like the older UI had.
**  !OLDSpaceDire.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
# Only the following filters are available.
**  !NEWSpaceDire.PNG|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: New Space Directory is missing Site Spaces filter

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

REST API Get comments limited to 100
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page on Confluence
 # Add more than 100 page or inline comments
 # Example:
{noformat}
/wiki/rest/api/content/<PAGEID>/child/comment?expand=body.storage,extensions.resolution&limit=200{noformat}

h3. Expected Results
 * See all the comments on the screen in json format.

h3. Actual Results
 * Comment limited to 100:
{code:xml}
start: 0,
limit: 200,
size: 100,{code}

h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: REST API Get comments limited to 100

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Two dimensional (Jira charts) not rendering correctly when there are many columns after publishing a page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # On a Confluence page, add Jira Charts macro and select Two dimensional.
 # Select a filter that contains many columns (such as "all issues").

h3. Expected Results

It shows clear information on the columns.

Edit mode:

!Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 18.35.56.png|width=330,height=224!
h3. Actual Results

Any column that have a long name, such as "Assignee" on the example below shows with line breaks which is difficult to read. It happens if using the full-width mode as well.

!Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 18.36.42.png|width=369,height=508!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Two dimensional not rendering correctly when there are many columns

fields.description:
h2.Problem
Currently, it is not possible to track down who deleted a Confluence page.

h2.Suggestion
It would be very helpful to have this information available in the audit logs.
fields.summary: Audit logs for page deletion

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Advanced search gives partial page name results, however, basic search gives full page title on the search
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # create a page with the name Foo_bar vs. Zoo_bar
 # search it under advance search by typing just zoo_bar
 # search it under quick search by typing just zoo_bar

h3. Expected Results

It should give the same results i.e full page title instead of the partial page title.
h3. Actual Results

In Advance search, if you type a partial page title, it will show the partial page title as a result instead of Foo_bar vs. Zoo_bar.
 Basic search works as expected

!image-2020-11-06-23-17-52-727.png|thumbnail! 
 !image-2020-11-06-23-18-15-711.png|thumbnail!
h3. Workaround

Use Basic search instead of advance search
fields.summary: Advance search gives partial page name results.

fields.description: Editing a template is a lot like editing a page – there are only a few small differences. Currently, there’s no way to add images or attachments in templates. Is adding images or attachment on the roadmap ?
fields.summary: Template roadmap

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The minus sign is removed on its own in the 'content by label' macro.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page add the 'content by label' macro.
 # Add a filter, 'with Tile', add minus sign with any page title. As shown in the below screenshot:
 !image-2020-11-06-19-46-56-723.png|thumbnail! 
# Save it.
# Again click on the pencil icon to edit the macro. The minus sign is now removed.
 !image-2020-11-06-19-52-16-491.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
The minus sign should stay intact.
h3. Actual Results
The minus sign gets removed on its own.

h3. Workaround
Add manually the minus sign.
fields.summary: The minus sign is removed on its own in the 'content by label' macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
The hyperlink does not get copied in tasks.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page.
 # Add a task and put one hyperlink in the task line.
# Copy the line and paste it on the same page.

h3. Expected Results
* The hyperlinks should get copied.
h3. Actual Results
* The hyperlinks do not get copied.

h3. Workaround
Put the hyperlink again manually.
fields.summary: The hyperlink does not get copied in tasks.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
On a page, the purple status macro is shown as grey within the *table filter* macro. 

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Install [Table Filter and Charts for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/27447/table-filter-and-charts-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] addon on the site.

 # Insert the table filter macro on the page, create a table with 3 columns and 3 rows.
 # Mention all the status colors within this table inside the table filter macro.

h3. Expected Results
The color changes shouldn't happen

h3. Actual Results
Purple color changes to *grey* in the preview mode of macro and view mode of the page: 
!Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 14.07.01.png|thumbnail! 
!Screen Shot 2020-11-06 at 14.07.46.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Wrong color for status in table filter macro

fields.description:
h4. Current behaviour
* The new in-editor loads the default editor and only then shows users the option for templates that they can use.
** [Create and edit content|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/create-and-edit-content/]

h4. Suggested behaviour
# Allow users to choose the template before loading the editor, or
# Give admins an option to choose how the template selection works
# Admins should be able to set the default editor used by the instance for all pages/blogs being created.
# Users should have the option of setting their personal default editor, within my profile.



h4. Notes
* This is helpful for admins who want their users to use the legacy editor, where in the current behaviour, the legacy editor is buried in the options, and users might proceed to use the new editor.
fields.summary: Option to have the older template selection instead of the in-editor template selection

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 - User not able to add a comment in attachment when using *drag this pin to add a comment* in an attachment that is not in the page.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Upload a pdf file in a page and save the page.
 # Edit the page and delete the attachment.
 # Go to the view attachment page (the attachment still shows there).
 # Click view and use *drag this pin to add a comment*

 or

1.Try to view the attachment from the attachment section of the page and try adding a comment.
h3. Expected Results
 - Users should be able to add a comment.

h3. Actual Results
 - The comment box opens but keeps spinning not showing the space to add a comment.
 - Even if the attachment is existing on the page, adding the comment in attachments through the page Attachment section renders the same issue.

h3. Workaround
 - Currently, you need to keep the attachment on the page in order to be able to use the *drag this pin to add a comment* feature.
 - Another workaround is to place an *attachment macro* on the homepage (overview page) of the space and view the pdf file from the macro to drag pin to add comment. This works only on homepage
fields.summary: Drag this pin to add a comment is not working in attachments when the attachment is not in the page

fields.description:
h4. Current behaviour
# The Share option on pages and Spaces can be used to share content with users in and out of they system and organisation.
# The option also allows us to share to Groups, and this will send emails out to inactive users in the Group.
# While these users can be removed from the Groups first, or just have their accounts deleted, there are use cases where the admin might not want to remove the users completely, and clearing the users from groups can take time.

h4. Suggested behaviour
* Have an option when sharing with Groups to leave out inactive users.
fields.summary: Option to leave out inactive users when sharing Pages and Spaces to Groups

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

There is a lack of functionality to allow for customized and advanced searching when using the Slack integration for Confluence and performing a search therein. As a Confluence and Slack integration user, it can become search results delivered in Slack can be confusing and unusable due to the search parameters defined in any given slack based search.
h3. Suggested Solution

Allow for advanced search and customizable search queries with Confluence / Slack integration to create better parity between native search and searching within the integration.
h3. Workaround

None
fields.summary: Support for advanced search and customizable search queries with Confluence / Slack integration

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The left sidebar does not collapse again when I move my mouse away.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

Example:
{quote}I have two monitors, confluence on the right monitor in a browser window and other things on the left monitor.
 With the sidebar collapsed (']' shortcut), when I move the mouse from the confluence window to the left monitor, the sidebar expands and covers the page content.
 Now I can't cross-reference the confluence content with whatever is happening on the left monitor.
 However, when I go back to confluence to collapse the side menu, it does not go away when I mouse over the page. Instead, I have to click the 'expand/collapse' shortcut twice. Once for it to properly expand, and then another time to hide it again.
 This is the same on firefox/chrome/safari
{quote}
h3. Expected Results

The left sidebar should collapse again.
h3. Actual Results

The left sidebar expands again and hides objects on the page.
h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Left sidebar does not collapse again when I move my mouse away

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If your page reaches a certain amount of comments, its performance will be affected. It starts to be noticeable on pages with more than 60 comments, and becomes more impactful on pages with more than 150 comments. 

Loading the page will take a considerable amount of time, and while scrolling on it it's possible to find some blank comments (only the user's avatar available - the comment content will take some extra seconds to render).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on Confluence.
 # Add a huge amount of comments on it.
 # Navigate on the page.

h3. Expected Results

Although it's understandable that the page takes a little longer to load due to the amount of content, the user should be able to navigate through the comments without issues.
h3. Actual Results

Note that the page will take more time than usual to load, and while scrolling on the comments it's possible to find some blank ones (that will take additional seconds to load):

!image-2020-11-05-11-48-56-999.png!
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Pages with a high amount of comments present degraded functionality

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you try to open the Restricted Pages list on a space that contains more than 2.000 unique restrictions, the request will timeout and you'll receive a "Page Unavailable" error in the browser UI / 500 Error in the console.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On any space, create a few pages
# Add at least 2.000 unique (user/group) restrictions to these pages. 
# Navigate to *Space Settings* > *Permissions* > *Restricted Pages*

h3. Expected Results
You are able to see the entire list of restricted pages.

h3. Actual Results
It takes a long time to load.
If you have something between 1.000 and 2.000, it will take a couple of minutes, but might eventually load.
If you have more than 2.000 pages, it will timeout at ~180 seconds and you'll receive a Page Unavailable error.

In the browser console, you'll observe a 500 error in a request to {{/wiki/listpermissionpages.action?key=<SPACEKEY>}}

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Opening Restricted Pages list, with more than 2.000 unique restrictions in the same space will result in a 500 error

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
* Currently, for the Content Report Table macro, we have to
## Fully type the labels into the text box with no autocomplete
## We have to explicitly add the "," to separate values 
## And we can only use "or" operators using the "," above.
* Compared to the Content by Label macro, we can
## Start typing a label, and it auto-suggest relevant labels
## Selecting a label adds it and no "," values need to be inserted by the user
## Supports not only "or" operation, but "and" and "not" as well.

h4. Suggestion
* Improve the Content Report Table macro so that it has the functionalities of the Content by Label macro.
fields.summary: Improve behavior of Content Report Table macro to be like Content by Label macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

After archiving a page the link gets broken in the reference page.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create 1 test page using the legacy editor.
 # Reference the URL on another page.
 # Archive the test page.

h3. Expected Results

According to our doc page [Archive pages|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/archive-pages/#Archiveapage-Whathappenswhenapageisarchived], 
{quote}Links to archived pages will still work. These links will have an “Archived” lozenge next to it, letting users know it’s a link to an archived page{quote} 
but this only happens in the current editor, not in the legacy, so our doc page should report that.

h3. Actual Results

The link is broken.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Archived page link broken

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If we add section layouts on the page, page history shows whole page contents instead of changed specific section.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Step 1 Create a page and add some content on the page and publish it.
 # Step 2 Edit the page again and insert section layout on the page and publish the page.
 # Step 3 Edit the page again and insert some test and publish the page.
 # Step 4 Go to page history and compare last 2 versions.

h3. Expected Results
Page history should show specific page section with changes details.
 !image-2020-11-04-17-02-10-964.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Actual Results
Page history shows whole page content.
 !image-2020-11-04-17-04-49-538.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Page History comparison shows whole page content

fields.description:
When users access the Confluence space/page first time, they get help pop-up of functioning how to use different options on space.

In same we get the popup of page tree mentioning as "Each space has it's own tree" .

The message should state as *its* rather than *it's* . There should not be a possessive apostrophe in "its" .
fields.summary: Change it's to its in page display popup

fields.description:
In Confluence, when a user attempts [to add labels to a page|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/use-labels-to-organize-your-content/] that will either not exist or [have specific characters|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-6008], the following will be displayed:

{quote}
*Error*
GraphQL error: Unexpected HTTP status: 500
{quote}

To demonstrate the behavior for both scenarios (with specific characters or adding non-existent labels), the following video has been recorded:

 [^labels-test.mp4] 

h3.Suggestion

This is a suggestion to have a specific message sharing the reasons on why the label can't be added to the page. This way, it allows the users to understand what needs to be done and proceed to include labels to the pages.
fields.summary: Improve error message when adding labels to a page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When a page has a high quantity of certain types of JPG, SVG or WEBP images, inside of a table or just pasted in the page,  these attachments can make the page to take much time for load or display an error after 52 seconds (timeout).

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page
 # Insert around 30 SVG images (tested with ~300KB SVG)
 # Publish the page

h3. Expected Results
* The page should load without problems

h3. Actual Results
* The page takes much time to load its contents or, after 52 seconds, it will display an error similar to the following one:
{quote}
h1. Something went wrong
Try refreshing the page. Refresh
If the problem persists, contact [Atlassian Support|https://support.atlassian.com/contact/#/] or your space admin with the following details so they can locate and troubleshoot the issue:
 * This code: *ce3oe7*
 * The URL of this page * Reload this page{quote}
|  !Screen Shot 2020-11-02 at 20.21.41.png|thumbnail!  |
* The following error is thrown at the browser's console:
{code:none}Error: GraphQL error: Exception querying the remote GraphQL service: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: 52,000 milliseconds timeout on connection http-outgoing-538743 [ACTIVE]
    at new t (bundle.esm.js:63)
    at t.getQueryResult (react-hooks.esm.js:269)
    at t.i.getExecuteResult (react-hooks.esm.js:73)
    at t.execute (react-hooks.esm.js:106)
    at v (react-hooks.esm.js:380)
    at d (react-hooks.esm.js:354)
    at v (react-hooks.esm.js:397)
    at nt (ContentBody.js:124)
    at $i (react-dom.production.min.js:153)
    at Da (react-dom.production.min.js:175){code}
* And this is the failing request:
{code:none}Request URL: https://INSTANCE.atlassian.net/cgraphql?q=QueryPreloader_ContentQuery
Request Method: POST
Status Code: 200 

Response:
{"errors":[{"message":"Exception querying the remote GraphQL service: java.net.SocketTimeoutException: 52,000 milliseconds timeout on connection http-outgoing-538743 [ACTIVE]","locations":[{"line":1,"column":122}],"path":["content"]}],"data":{"content":null}}{code}

h3. Notes
This usually happens with SVG and WEBP images but it was also noticed with certain types of JPG files.

h3. Workaround
There're two possible workarounds for this bug:
* Split the page into multiple pages containing less images
* Convert the images to PNG as this bug doesn't seem to be caused by those types of images
fields.summary: High quantity of certain JPG, SVG or WEBP images inside of a page causes performance issues

fields.description:
h3. Problem Definition

In the Confluence global date format configuration, the user is expected to type the date format. This can cause configuration errors.

For example in Confluence, the month is provided as MM(capital). The minutes are configured as mm(small letter). So a user may accidentally put the date configuration as dd/mm/yyyy HH: mm instead of dd/MM/yyyy HH: mm. This will cause the dates in all documents to be displayed incorrectly.
h3. Suggested Solution

Make the accepted date formats as a list so that the user can select the format from the list.
h3. Workaround

NA
fields.summary: Ability to make Confluence data format configuration as a list instead of manual entry.

fields.description:
h2. Description

 
  
 It is not currently possible to scroll to a particular point in a Confluence Cloud macro, because anchors in iframes do not affect the scrolling on the parent frame.

One way to achieve this could be to use the AP.scrollPosition API, but it only works for generalPages.
  
h2. Environment

 
  
 Confluence Cloud - ACJS project

cc: @david simpson
fields.summary: AP.scrollPosition only works for general pages

fields.description:
Running Firefox Developer Edition 83.0b6 highlighting text and clicking + Comment does not 
result in the inline comment popup window.  Instead it highlights the text as if you made a comment but no way of accessing it.  This works properly in Edge.
fields.summary: Can't Create Inline Comment in Firefox

fields.description:
h4. Issue summary
* Currently, all categories are listed in the Space directory, even if no Space exist that the user can access in that category.

h4. Suggested behavior
* Only list categories that has Spaces that a user can access.
fields.summary: Hide Categories from users who are not in any Spaces in that category

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * JIRA Issue Macro displays an empty field for *Parent Link* and *Team*.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page on *Confluence*.
 # Add a *Jira Issue Macro*.
 # Configure the *filter* and expand "Display Options".
 # Set the display to Table and add *Parent Link* and *Team* under "Columns to display".
 # Add the macro and *save the page*.

h3. Expected Results
 * The Parent Link and Team column gets populated.

h3. Actual Results
 * The columns are blank.

h3. Workaround
 * Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Parent Link/Team blank on JIRA Issue Macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If you, as a space-admin, do not have access to one of the pages that are restricted in a space, you used to be able to browse the list of restricted pages and manage those from there. However, if you do not have VIEW permissions in those pages, you can't see them even in the Restricted Pages list.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page in space where you have Administrator permissions
# Add restrictions to that page, so that it is restricted to you and another user/group that you are not a part of
# Go to the *Restricted Pages* list under *Space Settings* > *Permissions* > *Restricted Pages*
# Remove the padlocks that are specific tied to your user, or the spaces you're a member of.

h3. Expected Results
You should keep seeing the page listed in there, and you could lift the other restrictions to have access to it again.

h3. Actual Results
The page is hidden from you and you can't remove its restrictions.

h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Restricted Pages are hidden from the Restricted Pages list

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Upon adding an inline comment to a page, navigating to a different page and then, coming back to the page with the comment will not be it displayed, requiring a manual refresh to see it.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# On page A, add a new inline comment while viewing it.
# Through the sidebar, go to a different page.
# Go back to page A.

h3. Expected Results
The added inline comment should be displayed.

h3. Actual Results
The inline comment is not displayed. It is necessary to either refresh the page or wait for some time, go to a different page and then, go back to the page in question again. A video has been recorded to demonstrate the behavior:

 [^Inline test.mp4] 

h3. Workaround
Manually refresh the page after navigating to a different one and coming back to the page in question.
fields.summary: Adding an inline comment, navigating to another page, and coming back will not display the added comment

fields.description:
We are running Confluence 7.3.4

On a page with attachments, including old attachment versions, I was to delete some interim versions. I can delete only one-at-a-time. After deleting a version, control is returned to ViewPageAttachments. Then to access another version, we have to click the twisty again.

It would be VERY nice if we could:
 * Delete all but the newest version, for individual attachments and for all attachments on a page 
 * Select multiple versions of one attachment, with check boxes, and then process a single Delete
fields.summary: Delete select attachments

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
While creating a page using a template from the 'new template panel' creates a draft page as well.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Click on 'Create'
 # Select any of the templates.
  !image-2020-10-29-20-05-31-388.png|thumbnail! 
# Publish the Page.
# Go to Confluence Home Page-> Drafts. You will see a Draft Page created along with the Published page.
 !image-2020-10-29-20-09-13-455.png|thumbnail! 

h3. Expected Results
Only the Published Page should be created and not a draft page.
h3. Actual Results
A draft Page is also created along with the Published page.

h3. Workaround

 Currently, there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: While creating a page using a template from the 'new template panel' creates a draft page as well

fields.description:
From [https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/conditions/:]
{quote}{{has_attachment_permission}}, {{has_comment_permission}}, {{has_custom_content_permission}}, {{has_page_permission}} and {{has_space_permission}} require a key of the permission that will be checked for the current user to be passed via the {{permission}} parameter. Below you will find the keys of the valid permissions.
{quote}
Unfortunately, specifying permission key {{REMOVE}} for has_page_permission is inadequate to protect against the user deleting the page because the condition does not factor in the user's space permission. 

This request is for a new permission key to be provided that will allow apps to present UI only when the user has space and page permissions to delete the page in the current context.
fields.summary: Provide a condition property for space and page removal permissions

fields.description:
Apps sometimes need to perform complex UI initiated operations against Confluence entities such as spaces and pages. These operations need a page/panel for the app to present the UI allowing the operation to be triggered.

The page/panel containing the needs space/page context so that the app can specify relevant conditions including permission based conditions such as has_page_permission.

The resulting UI should not be disruptive to users. For example, a dialog results in the UI becoming modal and is inconvenient to have open for the duration of long running tasks. 

General pages are suitable for hosting the UI, but do not support all the conditions necessary such as has_page_permission. 

Possible solutions:

(a) Enhance general pages so they support context based conditions such as has_page_permission.

(b) Outline an experience/pattern that would allow a long running task to be triggered, say by UI in a dialog, but can be dismissed, but yet monitored by the user if they wish. Confirmation of success/failure would also be necessary.
h3.
fields.summary: Add the ability for apps to perform UI initiated long running context sensitive operations

fields.description:
h3. Suggestion Summary

Currently, Atlassian Cloud employs the Team feature. This feature allows for teams to be mentioned and tasks to be assigned to them. The team mention feature automatically creates mentions to all the team members when used.

Filtering tasks based on team name is not currently possible in the Task Report macro.
h3. Why is this important

Since we can now assign tasks to teams, we should also be able to filter tasks based on teams within the Task Report macro.
fields.summary: Allow Task Report macro to be filtered by Team name

fields.description:
I like the ability to archive pages which are old, but there does not seem to be a way to include them in search results if necessary.  I can include archived spaces in search results, but not archived pages.

The use case for this isn't uncommon.  If users report not being able to find some critical piece of information, I need to be able to determine if they couldn't find it because the only occurrence of that information was on a page that was archived for being mostly out of date or even just archived accidentally/unintentionally.  When a search term doesn't appear in search results, I don't want to have to tell another team "sorry, could you give us that info again? We lost it in Confluence" nor manually check every archived page.
fields.summary: Ability for space admins to search archived pages

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It is possible to use the [include page macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-include-page-macro/] to show content from other pages.

However, upon using the include page macro to show results from a page that has the page properties report macro, even though it is possible to see the results on edit mode, it doesn't reflect the same on the view mode.

The result is No content found.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page
 # Insert the page properties report macro on this page
 # Create a child page
 # Insert a page properties macro and some content to fill the page properties report and the label specified
 # Create a new page on another space
 # Insert the include page macro and choose the page with the page properties report
 # Publish

h3. Expected Results

The page properties report content is showing up on view mode.
h3. Actual Results

The page properties report content are only visible on edit mode, view mode the message No content found is displaying instead.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Include page macro doesn't display the content of page properties report in view mode.

fields.description:
Confluence teams are kind of neat but they're not really that useful. Yes if you have a big team it can save you time to tag them all as one but so far I haven't found any other use for it. There are a few things I think would improve the user experience and make people more likely to want to create teams and keep them updated, starting with using them as parameters in macros.

*Example*

Say for example teamA and teamB are working on different parts of a product. During teamA's sprint meeting they realise that in order for them to hit their goal teamB need to supply them with some information. So in their task list they add: @teamB to provide info by Nov 11.
Great this is now tagged and everyone in teamB who has a task report for themselves should be seeing this in their own task list. However when it comes to teamB's next meeting it's not showing on the task list in the meeting notes as it's not a task from one of the listed pages in that macro. If however one could use teamB as a parameter to the Assignee filed in the task report macro that would solve this and teamB would be sure to notice it in their next meeting.

*Comment*

It seems I can only add the premium version as a _Component_ though i believe this should be a feature in the standard version.
fields.summary: Use teams to filter macros

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Jira Issue / filter macro has a custom field included. Values for this field might be shown blank even though custom field value is not empty.
 Additionally, JQL search in Jira shows values for this field as well.

This issue is happening when you have a Jira issue with a custom field and this field is not configured in a "view" screen in Jira.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # In Jira, create a new custom field "custom A"
 # Configure a screen to have "custom A" field to be shown on "create issue" view only
 # Create a new issue and assign a value to this "custom A" field
 # Use Jira macro to show this issue, including "custom A" field. Compare output with the JQL search output

h3. Expected Results

In Jira filter Macro, custom field value should be shown, same way as it is shown in JQL search in Jira.
h3. Actual Results

In Jira filter Macro, value is blank for a custom field that doesn't have Jira view screen configured
h3. Workaround

Add custom field to the "view" screen in Jira. You need to make sure that field is visible in Jira when opening a Jira issue.
fields.summary: Jira issue / filter macro doesn't show values for fields that don't have screens configured in Jira

fields.description: When creating a template and adding a table, the table is added with centered alignment and there are no options to realign the table.  Users should be able to build templates and add tables either left justified, centered or right justified.
fields.summary: Allow Table Alignment on Templates

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Page contents/images are not loading if we access the page> access any link on the page and click on *back button* in browser (go back to the previous page), please find the screenrecording
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/5260881/5260881_screen-capture.webm
https://getsupport.atlassian.com/browse/JST-607409

Console log:
# {{Request URL: https://api.media.atlassian.com/file/183169fa-d77d-46cc-b767-0f488df0a088/image?allowAnimated=true&collection=contentId-44663112&height=942&max-age=2592000&mode=full-fit&width=2170}}
# {{Request Method: GET}}
# {{Status Code: 403}}

Response:
# {{code: "JwtAuthoriser:AuthorisationError"}}
# {{href: "https://api.media.atlassian.com#UnauthorizedError"}}
# {{title: "The token does not allow requested operation. "urn:filestore:collection:contentId-44663112" needs "read" permission"}}

From [~agisby]:
Log clearly shows that it is a token issue - if I had to guess I’d say the page is reusing the token from the second page when you go back to the first. Media does not control the token generation, that is something Confluence frontend would need to look into. Perhaps some weird interplay with them caching tokens / SPA stuff? Not sure, they’d need to investigate.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
See above.

h3. Expected Results
Media loads properly without having to reload.

h3. Actual Results
Media does not load, shows empty boxes, due to using the incorrect token.

h3. Workaround

Reloading the page makes it work
fields.summary: Clicking back button after visiting a link causes media to fail to load

If a user tries to paste an image inside an info page, using Confluence's new editor, the panel will actually be split in two, and the image placed between these two panels, as can be seen in this next GIF:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

"Create from template" macro doesn't have default space assigned when adding it via Global template.
 As a result, "Template name" drop-down is empty, you cannot choose anything and save the macro.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new Global template
 # Add "create from template" macro
 # Check that "Template name" drop-down is empty and "space key" is not specified.  !image-2020-10-26-12-02-05-087.png|width=275,height=168!

h3. Expected Results

A default "Space key" should be assigned and "Template name" drop-down should have options.
h3. Actual Results

"Space key" is empty and as a result "template name" drop-down is empty as well. You cannot save macro.

Error in console log:
{code:java}
"errorCode":400,"errorType":"PARAMETER:MISSING","errorData":"spaceKey","errorMessage":"Missing 'spaceKey' parameter"{code}
h3. Workaround

You can specify "Space key" first and then proceed with drop-down options for "template name".
Keep in mind that you will also need to click "edit" on "create from template" macro once page is created - this will help to update space key value to the one where page is located.

*Note:* _For Firefox and IE, "space key" options might be not properly visible (scroll-down will not work)._
fields.summary: "Create from template" Macro is not added properly to a Global Template

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
 * When you add a Jira Macro, you are able to look for Jira filters, that will retrieve the desired info. Recently, however, due to Confluence not rendering filters' drop-down menu correctly, users are unable to select the desired filter. The drop-down menu seems to be rendered behind the macro insert modal.

This issue currently affects:
 * Filter Results
 * Created vs. Resolved Chart
 * Pie Chart
 * Recently Created Chart
 * Average Time in Status
 * Jira Road Map (Gadget)
 * Activity Stream (Gadget)

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page > add one Jira macro (in this case we'll use Pie Chart)
 # The Filter box and statistic type box sit on top of each other so you can barely see the input box for the filter (screenshot 1)
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.05.17.png|width=699,height=434!
 # Click on the very top of the dialogue box (you'd have to be almost pixel perfect) to search for the filter's keywords;

h3. Expected Results
 * The drop-down menu to display filter results based on key-words.

h3. Actual Results
 * The *Filter* dialogue box is not properly rendered, and when you are able to click on it and add key-words the actual drop-down menu with the filters' results is not shown to the user.
 * It seems that the drop-down menu is rendered behind the macro insertion modal.

!Screen Shot 2020-10-22 at 16.33.36.png|width=388,height=234! 
 (Part of the drop-down being rendered)
h3. Workaround
* Typing the filter's name and then pressing the *Down Arrow* Key will allow the filter to be selected.
 * If you type a few letters (e.g. "asd"), and hit enter on your keyboard the *Filter* dialogue box will be expanded, allowing you to see what you're typing;
 * It seems that in some cases adding the first two letters of the filter that you're looking for will generate a drop-down list with possible filters;
 * Otherwise, you'd have to type the precise Filter's name in order to search for it, and hit enter twice. (The issue here is that the drop-down menu is not rendered correctly, and the correct option will be selected, but you won't be able to see it)
fields.summary: Filter Search on Jira macros is not working properly

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
After [adding a table in the editor|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/add-formatting-to-your-page/#Addformattingtoyourpage-tables] and including the same sentence for each row, but, only a different number at the end of each, it will not allow the sort to work.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Edit/create a page in Confluence.
# Add a table on the page. 
# Make sure that this table has the same sentence in different rows, but, only a different number at the end of each.
# Publish the page
# Tap the sorting option for the created table.

h3. Expected Results
The sorting should work based on the numbers, as it happens with sentences with numbers at the beginning or only numbers for each row.

h3. Actual Results
The sort does not work, in opposite to numbers only or numbers at the beginning of the sentence, like the gif demonstrating the example below:

 !sorting.gif|thumbnail!

(i) This also affects a list of numbers that will have a single letter inside (different letters or the same letter, but, with different numbers), like in the image below:

!single.png|thumbnail!

h3. Workaround
Add the numbers to the beginning of the sentence instead.
fields.summary: Sorting columns with numbers at the end of a sentence will not work

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When you insert an image on the legacy editor, it is possible to add text on the line.
However, if you align the image, to the left for example, the text goes below the image and it is not possible to put the text back to the image's line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page in the legacy editor
 # Add an image
 # Add some text on the same line as the image
# Align the image to the left (the text will go below)
# Try to insert the text back on the image's line

h3. Expected Results
It is possible to get the text back to the same image's line

h3. Actual Results
It is not possible to add the text to the same line as the image is after the align


h3. Workaround
Remove the content and add it again, without aligning the image.
The text will should stay on the same line as the image is.
fields.summary: Inserting an image on legacy editor inside the panel macro and then aligning the image, does not allow the text to be in the same line

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

The option to change restrictions has been removed from actions that can be done on a page, now it is only possible through the lock icon. However, it is not possible to change the restrictions on the *Overview page* because there is no lock icon on it.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new space.
 # On the overview page, go to *More (...)*
 # There is no option to change page restrictions

h3. Expected Results

There should be a way to change restrictions on the Overview page.
h3. Actual Results

There is no option to change restrictions on the Overview page.
h3. Workaround

In case the Overview pages were restricted before this change was made, the user can remove all restrictions by navigating to *Space Settings > Permissions > Restricted Pages*

Find the Overview page in the list of restricted pages and remove restrictions by clicking on the lock next to each user's name. After that, the pages become open to everyone who is allowed to view the space.
fields.summary: There is no longer the option to change restrictions on the overview page

fields.description:

 # Publish the page.
 # Click on any link generated by the  *Live Search* macro.

h2. Troubleshooting performed:
 *  I see that upon using the search option in the page I see that the image in search results redirects to a " *Dead link*" and below errors re-logged in our developer tools:

{code:java}
Request Method: GET
Status Code: 404 
Remote Address: 18.136.214.1:443

content-encoding: gzip
content-type: text/html;charset=UTF-8

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

This bug tracks any reports of page performance issues on the LEGACY EDITOR. These issues may be caused by a large number of tables with data.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a la page with 10+ tables each with around 10-20 rows
 # Notice that the performance of the table was slow while inserting some text to the table.
 # Page load times vastly increase

h3. Expected Results

Performance of the table should be stabilized while inserting text on the tables.
h3. Actual Results

Degraded performance while editing page and intermittent inability to save.
h3. Workaround

Try removing elements on the page or splitting up the page and see if that improves the editing speed. If you are able to remove elements and see performance improvements, please share as a comment to help us narrow our focus on key elements that are slowing page performance.
fields.summary: Slow Performance while editing Legacy Editor Page

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
When using the /wiki/rest/api/content/search endpoint to search for pages based on modified/ created dates, the API is currently using the instance's timezone instead of the one defined on the user's profile.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a page and remember the exact time of creation
# Use the  /wiki/rest/api/content/search endpoint to look for pages created/ modified at that time
e.g. {{/wiki/rest/api/content/search?cql=(lastmodified > "2020-10-19 19:00")}}
# Change your profile's timezone
# Search again, changing the time to reflect the specific timezone chosen

h3. Expected Results
The results should be based on the user's timezone (set individually on the user settings/ profile)

h3. Actual Results
The search will be based on the instance's timezone (timezone for the user who created the instance). 

h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Search REST API uses the instance's timezone instead of the user's one

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If your Instance has JSD + Confluence, it's possible to use Confluence as a KB for a JSD project. When configuring JSD, it's possible to make changes to below setting:

*Can customers access and send requests from the help center without logging in?*
 
Marking this option as *Yes* will enable Anonymous Access on Confluence Global Permissions. However, any JSD admin will be able to change this (even if this user is not an admin on Confluence).
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Instance with both Jira Service Desk and Confluence.
 # Make sure that Anonymous access is not enabled on Confluence Global Permissions.
 # Create a JSD project, and link it to a Confluence Space.
 # Log on JSD with an account that doesn't have admin access on Confluence.
 # Access the JSD settings (<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa).
 # Mark *Can customers access and send requests from the help center without logging in?* as *Yes*.
 # Click on *Got it*.

h3. Expected Results

The user shouldn't be able to change this setting, as it would reflect in an app that he/she doesn't administer.
h3. Actual Results

Anonymous access is enabled on Confluence.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: JSD admins can enable Anonymous access on Confluence even if they are not Confluence administrators

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If your Instance has JSD + Confluence, it's possible to use Confluence as a KB for a JSD project. When configuring JSD, it's possible to make changes to below setting:

*Can customers access and send requests from the help center without logging in?*
 
Marking this option as *Yes* will enable Anonymous Access on Confluence Global Permissions. JSD will notify the user about this change, however, in case the user accepts, Confluence Global permission will be changed and this change won't be logged on Confluence Audit Logs. 
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Set up an Instance with both Jira Service Desk and Confluence.
 # Make sure that Anonymous access is not enabled on Confluence Global Permissions.
 # Create a JSD project, and link it to a Confluence Space.
 # Access the JSD settings (<INSTANCE>.atlassian.net/secure/admin/SDConfiguration.jspa).
 # Mark *Can customers access and send requests from the help center without logging in?* as *Yes*.
 # Click on *Got it*.
 # Access Confluence's Audit Log.

h3. Expected Results

As this permission was changed on Confluence, there should be an entry for it on the Audit Log.
h3. Actual Results

This change is not logged on the Audit Log.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Enabling Confluence Anonymous Access through JSD won't create a record on Confluence Audit Logs

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

3rd party macros were misinterpreted as Confluence native macros after migration to cloud.
h3. Steps to Reproduce

The ServiceRocket team is looking into the Cloud migration path for a specific macro, _Tabs_, for one of our apps, [Composition Tabs for Confluence|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/245/composition-tabs-for-confluence?hosting=cloud&tab=overview]. This app exists both in Server and Cloud. Its primary function is to provide a tabbed view of Confluence content. In Server, the macros are called _Deck_ and _Card_ macros.
 
We understand that in Cloud, Atlassian owns macros with the same name but different display outcome. Maybe as a means to provide a placeholder for inexistent corresponding macros in Cloud.

_Deck_ macro:
!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=c242eba2f2&attid=0.1&permmsgid=msg-f:1680053085948551672&th=1750bf615fc321f8&view=fimg&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ8KMLJutv4yiWzPMpyI89Ny0te3ZGCLCVEcasSKRQCmpo3973H7KUkzdbH5XebeXcY8PYslVP3yaocFP5HHSaL-jPbaQzEunsrfXeVnGkYdUx8ETIxYucoN3DE&disp=emb&realattid=ii_kg1ucg2o0|width=581,height=427!
 
_Card_ macro:
 
!https://mail.google.com/mail/u/0?ui=2&ik=c242eba2f2&attid=0.2&permmsgid=msg-f:1680053085948551672&th=1750bf615fc321f8&view=fimg&sz=s0-l75-ft&attbid=ANGjdJ8xnBOEBugQPIkcOMpjl7Ioqg2O2MFrh82B8lCGRC5EXV77euR8PG8CzoELnHk_3qZAYVMk0bBUU9fgg2aXXiwIsUPee34rPBh_EK92wh7aRGL1WUsH_p-j6GQ&disp=emb&realattid=ii_kg1udx401|width=588,height=381!
 
This results in migrating customers unknowingly converting to Atlassian macros, due to the name share. This could be a challenge for us as we would love to retain our migrating server customers using the _Deck_ and _Card_ macros or at least give them an option to choose.
h3. Expected Results

ServiceRocket macros should be migrated to cloud as the same corresponding ServiceRocket macros in server.
h3. Actual Results

ServiceRocket Deck macro and Card macro were migrated to cloud as Confluence native macros due to duplicate naming/ID.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: 3rd party macros misinterpreted as Confluence native macros after migration to cloud

fields.description:

fields.description:
As part of a recent change on Confluence Cloud (further details in this [Developer Community post|https://community.developer.atlassian.com/t/upcoming-ui-update-to-the-page-overflow-menu-in-confluence-cloud/41897]) we have changed the Page Menu, dividing the options into sections, and removing some redundant items. One of the items removed was the *View in Hierarchy* option (as it is possible to check the hierarchy accessing the Reorder Pages, on the Space administration). Although it is possible to still access this functionality on the Space Settings, it require more clicks and effort from customer side.
h4. Proposed Solution

Bring back the *View in Hierarchy* option to the Page Menu.
fields.summary: Bring back the View in Hierarchy option on the Page Menu

The list is pasted using Confluence default list formatting
h3. Actual Results

The result will vary depending on the source of the original list

Apple Pages

HTML Content

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Copying colored text from any source other than Fabric itself and then pasting it into Confluence loses the original chosen color.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a new page in Confluence
 # Copy colored text from another source other than Fabric itself
 # Paste it into the recently created Confluence page

h3. Expected Results

The color formatting is kept
h3. Actual Results

The color formatting is lost, even though the answer to this report says that keeping the original color format is expected:

https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-61861

 

It only works when copying from the Fabric (New) editor itself.

 

Examples

From Microsoft Word:

!Screen-Recording-2020-10-16-at-1.gif|width=163,height=100!

From Apple Pages

!Screen-Recording-2020-10-16-at-1(1).gif|width=171,height=104!

From HTML Content

!Screen-Recording-2020-10-16-at-1(2).gif|width=199,height=121!

From the Legacy Editor

!Screen-Recording-2020-10-16-at-1(3).gif|width=192,height=117!

 

Example where it works:

From Fabric:

!Screen-Recording-2020-10-16-at-1(4).gif|width=205,height=125!
h3. Workaround

No workaround. We need to manually set the text color again
fields.summary: Pasting colored text into Confluence loses original color formatting

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
A hyperlink does not re-direct a user to the Anchor Heading if it contains a slash ( / ) in it

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page, add a heading with a slash in it ( / ). _ex: *Hi / hello*_
 # Copy it links and put it in a hyperlink on the same page.
# Publish the page.

h3. Expected Results
When a user clicks on a hyperlink, the user should be redirected to the Anchor heading (with '/').

h3. Actual Results
The user is not redirected to the anchor heading when a user clicks on its respective hyperlink.

h3. Workaround
Remove '/' from the heading.

    at HTMLDocument.<anonymous> (batch.js?externals=__local-default__&locale=en-US:889)

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

On Confluence, if you paste a link to another page on the editor, this link will be automatically replaced by a SmarLink, which would be a card with the page's title. For example:

!image-2020-10-14-18-52-28-254.png!

This behavior also happens when pasting a link to a page within a table/Page Properties macro. However, if you edit this page and change its title, although the new title will reflect on the Page Properties, the Page Properties Report will still show the old one.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page (for example, *Atlassian Support Test*).
 # Create another page (for example, *Testing links within Page Properties*), and then pace a table within a Page Properties macro. 
 # Add the link to *Atlassian Support Test* on the table. For example:
 !image-2020-10-14-18-58-30-382.png|width=558,height=170!
 # Add a label to this page.
 # Create another page (for example, *Page Properties Report Test*), and place the Page Properties Report macro on it.
 # Configure the macro to pull pages with the label used on *Testing links within Page Properties*, and make sure to set the report to pull the link column. For example:
 !image-2020-10-14-19-00-12-659.png!
 # Edit *Atlassian Support Test*, updating its title.
 # Check both pages now:
 - *Testing links within Page Properties*
 - *Page Properties Report Test*

h3. Expected Results

The updated title should reflect on both pages.
h3. Actual Results

The title is updated on *Testing links within Page Properties*, but not on *Page Properties Report Test:*

!image-2020-10-14-19-03-05-133.png|width=605,height=186!

!image-2020-10-14-19-03-34-838.png|width=586,height=72!
h3. Workaround

Performing a dump update on *Testing links within Page Properties* would fix the issue (there's no need to change anything on the page's content).
fields.summary: Updating the title of a page which its link is on a Page Properties macro will reflect on the Page Properties but won't on the Page Properties Report

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

If you have an [Atlassian Access subscription|https://www.atlassian.com/software/access], you are able to configure User Provisioning to your Org, so you can easily manage your users, by syncing groups from external Identity Providers. It's not possible to add members to the synced groups on the Instance Management UI (<your-site>.atlassian.net/admin), only on the idP. However, using the [Confluence Cloud REST API to add users to groups|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/#api-api-group-user-post], it's possible to add users to synced groups.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # First, make sure you have:
*A verified domain;*
*An Atlassian Access subscription;*
*User Provisioning set with an external Identity Provider.*
 # On the Instance administration, get the name of the group that is being synced.
 # Get an AAID from a user from the Instance that is not part of this synced group.
 # Use the [API|https://developer.atlassian.com/cloud/confluence/rest/api-group-group/#api-api-group-user-post].

h3. Expected Results

The API shouldn't work, and the user shouldn't be added to the group.
h3. Actual Results

The user is added to the synced group.
h3. Workaround

Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Confluence Cloud REST API allow to add users to synced groups from external directories

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
If a page has a Team calendars or Google Drive macro and the team calendars or [Google Drive for Confluence (official)|https://marketplace.atlassian.com/apps/1213092/google-drive-for-confluence-official?hosting=cloud&tab=overview] add-on is not installed in the instance, the page will fail to load and be edited.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Install to the Google Drive app
# Add a Google Drive macro to a page and publish it
# Uninstall the add-on
# Refresh the page / try to edit it


h3. Expected Results
The page should still be displayed and be editable

h3. Actual Results
* The page won't load with the following error message:
{quote}(x) We couldn't display your content
Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support{quote}
* It can't be edited with the following error message:
{quote} (x) We couldn't load the editor.
Refresh the page and try again. If the problem persists, contact Atlassian Support.{quote}

h3. Workaround
* Re-install the add-on and remove the macro from the page

Or 

* Contact us through [https://support.atlassian.com/] mentioning this case so we can remove the macro directly from the page's source code.
fields.summary: Pages can't be displayed nor edited if they have an add-on macro and the add-on is not installed
Jira issue/filter macro is not showing information from custom label field created in Jira

fields.description:
h3. Summary
When we try to create a new Software Project Space in Confluence, Jira Projects are not listed unless the user has "Create Issue" or "Work On Issues" Project permission in JIRA.


h3. Step to reproduce

# In Jira, grant only "Browse Projects" to a specific user/group/role, so that the user can view the projects and the issues within them, but cannot create issues;
# In Confluence, go to Spaces Menu and click on "Create space";
# Select "Software project space" and click on Next;

h4. Expected Result

User is able to see the projects as they do in JIRA and then creates the related Space in Confluence.

h4. Actual Result

The Project is not listed in Confluence, even though the user can browse it in JIRA.

In order to have the project shown up in Confluence, user must have "Create Issues" or "Work On Issues" permission in JIRA.


The problem is that some users might not edit information in a Project because of security reasons, but they can be responsible for creating the Software Project Space in Confluence.
fields.summary: JIRA requires inaccurate permission to create a software project space in Confluence

fields.description:
h3. Summary

Sprint Burndown Gadget shows the label *Board* for the field *Sprint*.
!image-2020-10-13-11-11-44-018.png!
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Add a Sprint Burndown Gadget macro.

h3. Expected Results

The macro settings will show the label *Sprint* for the field *Sprint*.
h3. Actual Results

The macro settings show the label *Board* for the field *Sprint*.

*Notes*:

h3. Workaround

Currently, there is no workaround to apply on this bug.
fields.summary: Sprint Burndown Gadget has incorrect field for Sprint

fields.description:

Team Calendars is eventually throwing an error up on the screen without an apparent reason. This comes and goes, so it happens intermittently.

Some events throw errors at the top of the calendar saying it was a PSQL exception 
!image-2020-10-14-08-34-02-131.png!

*Notes*:

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Content by label macro display all the lines in an Excerpt macro of the returned page, rather than the first line.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a page with any text inside an Excerpt macro
 # Create a label for the created page
 # Create another page and insert the Content by label macro
 # On the filter, add the label of the page with the Excerpt macro selecting on the Display excerpts the option simple

h3. Expected Results
According to the doc page [Insert the content by label macro|https://support.atlassian.com/confluence-cloud/docs/insert-the-content-by-label-macro/], when using the Display excerpts, *Simple*, it should display only *the first line* of text contained in an Excerpt macro any of the returned pages.

h3. Actual Results
Is showing *all the lines* if the text contained in an Excerpt macro any of the returned pages.

h3. Workaround
Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available.
fields.summary: Content by label macro display all the lines in an Excerpt macro

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

An error is shown in Team Calendars for *Jira Issues Dates* event type
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a project on Jira with at least 5 issues
 # Create a custom field using the *Date and Time picker* type and set its value on all of the 5 issues
 # Create a Calendar on Confluence
 # Add an event using *Jira Issues Dates* and fill the JQL field
 # Set the field created on step 2
 # Save it and reload the page

h3. Expected Results

It should display the calendar
h3. Actual Results

An error is thrown at the UI:
 !Screen Shot 2020-10-12 at 19.42.05.png|width=700! 
{quote}Error(s) occurred.

Unable to load events of broken - CALENDAR NAME (f748534b-65d0-4683-8119-c363cda58269): com.atlassian.confluence.extra.calendar3.exception.CalendarException: calendar3.error.jiralink
{quote}

h3. Workaround
It's been noticed that if the field is just a Date one (instead of date and time) it doesn't fail. Based on that, the workaround would be to replace the selected field with a Date only field.
fields.summary: Jira Calendars on Confluence are throwing an error

fields.description: The ability for Team Calendars to disable "export to iCalendar" would be important for the customer who always concerned about leaking confidential information to the outside. fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary
Events set to *All day* are not triggering reminders to the users that are following the calendar.

h3. Steps to Reproduce
# Create a calendar
# Create a new event of any event type and set it to *All day event*
# Set a reminder for that specific event type
# Make sure you're watching the calendar and enable the reminders for all event types

h3. Expected Results
You should receive a reminder notification related to that event

h3. Actual Results
No reminders are currently being triggered/ sent to *All day events*

h3. Workaround
Currently the only available workaround is to create another event at the beginning of the day without setting it to *All day* in order to trigger the reminder.
fields.summary: All day events are not notifying users watching the calendar

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

It's possible to add a Jira Issue/Filter macro on a Confluence page, to display results on Jira, based on a JQL query. Instead of displaying the details for the issues, the macro can be used to display total issue counts. However, in case the page has many of them (I was able to replicate on pages with more than 90), they don't work properly when editing the page.

(on) The page works properly on view mode, this issue only happens on edit mode.
h3. Steps to Reproduce
 # Create a Confluence page.
 # Add the Jira Issue/Filter macro on it, setting it to display total issue count.
 # Copy this macro, and place it on the page 89 times.
 # Publish the page.
 # Note that all counts will work as expected. Now, access the page on edit mode.

h3. Expected Results

The issue counts should work as they do on view mode. 
h3. Actual Results

The macro displays below error message:

!image-2020-10-09-19-32-08-108.png!
h3. Workaround

If you click over the macro error, you'll be able to click on the pencil to edit it. Then, note that the filter loads properly on the macro preview. Clicking on the *Insert* button will fix the macro on the editor. However, this issue may happen again (it's intermittent and the fix is not permanent).
fields.summary: Jira Issue/Filter showing total issue count is not working properly on edit mode
